title: Switch to permanent text-only “Forge AI” branding and remove icon mark across UI + favicon

requirements.summary: Remove the Forge icon mark from all user-visible UI surfaces and enforce text-only “Forge AI” branding everywhere it appears.
acceptanceCriteria: No pages render the icon mark image in any header/footer/hero branding area; branding is represented as text-only “Forge AI”.
All visible brand text uses exactly the string “Forge AI” (including casing and spacing).
No UI surface regresses to icon+text lockups when navigating between routes.

file_operations.description: Refactor the ForgeBrandMark component so it only renders text-only branding (exact string “Forge AI”) and never renders an icon or references the Forge icon asset, ensuring all existing UI surfaces that use this component become text-only.
Update global header branding usage to render text-only “Forge AI” via ForgeBrandMark while preserving existing home link behavior and focus/keyboard accessibility (no icon lockup).
Update the hero branding area to use the text-only ForgeBrandMark (no icon lockup) and confirm the hover/scale wrapper still behaves without layout breakage.
Update homepage hero branding to use the text-only ForgeBrandMark (no icon lockup) and ensure hero spacing/centering remains intact.

requirements.summary: Update reusable branding component(s) to support text-only branding only, and update all callers to stop requesting icon-based variants.
acceptanceCriteria: The component currently defined in frontend/src/components/ForgeBrandMark.tsx does not render an tag for the brand icon.
Global header branding (frontend/src/components/GlobalHeader.tsx) renders text-only branding while preserving existing link behavior and focus/keyboard accessibility.

Homepage hero branding areas that currently import/use ForgeBrandMark (e.g., frontend/src/pages/ForgeHomePage.tsx and frontend/src/components/HeroSection.tsx) render text-only branding without layout breakage.

file_operations.description: Remove/disable icon-based API surface (e.g., eliminate the icon-text/wordmark variant prop patterns) so the component’s default and only supported render is text-only “Forge AI”, preventing regressions back to icon+text lockups.
Remove any icon-based variant requests (e.g., variant="icon-text") from ForgeBrandMark usage and rely on the text-only default.
Remove any icon-based variant requests (e.g., variant="icon-text") from ForgeBrandMark usage and rely on the text-only default.
Remove any icon-based variant requests (e.g., variant="icon-text") from ForgeBrandMark usage and rely on the text-only default.

requirements.summary: Remove the Forge icon mark from site chrome metadata so the app no longer references the Forge icon asset as a favicon.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html no longer references /assets/generated/forge-icon-v2.dim_256x256.png as the favicon.
After change, the app builds without broken asset references to the removed favicon path.

file_operations.description: Remove the favicon <link> reference to /assets/generated/forge-icon-v2.dim_256x256.png so the browser tab no longer references the Forge icon mark.
Delete the generated Forge icon favicon asset to prevent any accidental future references to the icon mark and ensure the build has no dependency on this path.
